alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Delaware; Dubuque; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Buchanan, northwestern Dubuque, northeastern Benton, northwestern Jones, Delaware and northern Linn Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1145 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greeley to near Urbana. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greeley around 1150 PM CDT. Colesburg around 1155 PM CDT. New Vienna and Luxemburg around 1200 AM CDT. Troy Mills around 1205 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Holy Cross, Paris, Central City, Coggon, Rickardsville, Balltown, Ryan and Prairieburg. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 37 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Buchanan; Delaware; Dubuque; Jones; Linn
